Plot.
Crime Boss Francis "Frank" Costello leads and raises young Colin Sullivan 
(Matt Damon) to be a mole in the Massachusetts State Police. Meanwhile, his 
eventual rival Billy Costigan (DiCaprio) is recruited by Staff Sergeant 
Dignam (Mark Wahlberg) and Captain Queenan (Martin Sheen) to go undercover 
to infiltrate the mob. In this epic, explosive, mystifying movie, the two 
search after each other as they are both involved affairs of the opposite 
organization. Playing the cat-and-mouse game constantly through the film, 
in the end, Sullivan connects to Costigan who refuses to cancel his mission. 
Sullivan additionally learns of Costello's role as informer for the FBI, 
causing him to care about his identity. Later on, Costigan finds an envelope 
from Costello revealing Sullivan's plan as a mole. Madolyn (Farmiga), 
Sullivan's girlfriend, hears the plans from the envelope and finds Sullivan 
is working as a mole for the mob. On a roof, Costigan finds Sullivan sorry 
and with hesitation, and identifies him as the mole, arresting him, but when 
he takes him down the elevator, he is shot by Trooper Barrigan, who is also 
working as a source for the mob, who is then shot later by Sullivan, who 
identifies Barrigan rather as the mole. In this suspenseful, deceitful, 
conniving thriller, Sullivan is finally identified as the mole who pervaded 
the FBI.
